item.title: The Lede: Egyptian Activist Defends Anti-Israel Tweets
item.description: A prominent Egyptian activist issued a defiant response Thursday to critics who argue that her anti-Israel stance should disqualify her from consideration for a major international award.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Engineer Arrested in Bangladeshi Building Collapse
item.description: The arrest of the engineer, Abdur Razzaque Khan, was a surprise twist since he was regarded as something of a hero for trying to avert the April 24 disaster.
item.dc:creator: By JIM YARDLEY and JULFIKAR ALI MANIK

item.title: World Briefing | Africa: Kenya: 2 Iranian Plotters Convicted
item.description: Two Iranian citizens, whom officials accused of planning to attack Western targets inside Kenya, were found guilty on Thursday by a Kenyan court of terrorism-related charges.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | Africa: Sudan: Dozens Die in Gold Mine
item.description: More than 60 miners were killed this week in the Darfur region when the gold mine they were working in collapsed, a police spokesman said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: Obama Meets With Mexican President Enrique Peña Nieto
item.description: President Obama meets with President Enrique Peña Nieto of Mexico as both leaders seek to shift attention from security issues to the vast economic relationship between the two nations.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD
item.media:description: President Obama and President Enrique Peña Nieto of Mexico, center, at the Palacio Nacional in Mexico City for talks on Thursday.

item.title: World Briefing | Africa: Chad: Coup Is Foiled, Official Says
item.description: Four officials have been arrested in connection with a foiled attempt to overthrow the government of Chad, the country’s state prosecutor announced Thursday.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | The Americas: Venezuela: Legal Challenge to Vote
item.description: Lawyers for the opposition candidate in the recent presidential election, Henrique Capriles Radonski, on Thursday submitted papers to the Supreme Court challenging the result.
item.dc:creator: By WILLIAM NEUMAN

item.title: World Briefing | Europe: Britain: Businessman Sentenced for Selling Fake Bomb Detectors
item.description: A British businessman who sold fake bomb detectors was sentenced to 10 years in prison for fraud on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: U.S. Lifts Visa Ban on Officials From Myanmar
item.description: Lifting the ban is the latest effort by the Obama administration to reward Myanmar after its president, Thein Sein, began to open the country’s political system and economy in 2011.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By STEVEN LEE MYERS

item.title: European Bank Cuts Rate, but Signals It Has Limits
item.description: The bank remains unwilling or unable to wield the more powerful weapons that many economists say are needed to jolt Europe out of recession.
item.dc:creator: By JACK EWING
item.media:description: The European Central Bank has cut rates four times since Mario Draghi took over as president in November 2011.

item.title: ‘Star Trek Into Darkness’ Aims for World Audience
item.description: Paramount Pictures had international moviegoers in mind when making casting and script decisions for “Star Trek Into Darkness.”
item.category: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
item.dc:creator: By BROOKS BARNES
item.media:description: “Star Trek Into Darkness” has a more Earth-centered story than other movies in the franchise.

item.title: India Ink: Admissions Anxiety Is Felt Around the World
item.description: What happens when an American family lives overseas and it’s time to apply for college? A writer who specializes in higher education and his daughter begin their search.
item.dc:creator: By TANYA ABRAMS

item.title: Greek Lawmaker Accused of Swinging at Athens Mayor
item.description: A lawmaker in Greece’s right-wing Golden Dawn party was accused of trying to punch the mayor of Athens, but missing and hitting a 12-year-old girl instead.
item.dc:creator: By NIKI KITSANTONIS

item.title: Santa Cruz Journal: Killing Puts Spotlight on Bolivian Drugs and Crime
item.description: A crime wave prompts a nation to look within and to its borders with Brazil and Peru.
item.dc:creator: By WILLIAM NEUMAN
item.media:credit: Meridith Kohut for The New York Times
item.media:description: Police detained three men they identified as suspicious during a late-night crime sweep in Santa Cruz, Bolivia.

item.title: Syrian Forces Strike Rebels in Wide-Ranging Assaults
item.description: Antigovernment activists reported attacks against insurgent enclaves in a Mediterranean port and at least two major cities.
item.category: National Coalition of Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces
item.dc:creator: By HANIA MOURTADA and RICK GLADSTONE
item.media:description: President Bashar al-Assad, center right, paid a visit to an electrical station in Damascus, the capital, on Wednesday.

item.title: At War Blog: It Wasn’t Supposed to End This Way for Tim Johns
item.description: Senior Chief Tim Johns, a Navy explosive ordnance disposal technician who had gone through hell and back again more than a few times, was killed in an car wreck.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By JOHN ISMAY
item.media:credit: From the personal photos of Scott Russell
item.media:description: Senior Chief Tim Johns, manning a tactical radio on deployment in Afghanistan, 2009.

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: May 2
item.description: Men use water from a leaking pipe to bathe on the outskirts of Bhubaneswar, Orissa.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: Men bathing in water gushing out from a leaking pipe, on the outskirts of Bhubaneswar, Orissa.

item.title: Hagel Confirms U.S. Is Considering Arming Syrian Rebels
item.description: Mr. Hagel was the first senior United States official to officially describe the Obama administration’s decision to reassess providing arms to the opposition fighters.
item.category: National Coalition of Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces
item.dc:creator: By THOM SHANKER and MARK LANDLER

item.title: British Group Criticizes European Transaction Tax Plan
item.description: London businesses would be hurt the most, said a report.
item.dc:creator: By STEPHEN CASTLE

item.title: United States Calls on North Korea to Free American
item.description: The Obama administration wants the American, who was sentenced to 15 years of hard labor, to be granted “amnesty and immediate release.”
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN and RICK GLADSTONE
item.media:description: Kenneth Bae in an undated image taken from video.

item.title: Pope Emeritus Benedict Takes Up Residence at Vatican
item.description: With his return, the pope emeritus inaugurates a living arrangement as unusual as it may be unpredictable: a former pope and a current pope both living within the Vatican walls.
item.dc:creator: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
item.media:description: A helicopter carrying Benedict XVI, the pope emeritus, landed at the Vatican on Thursday.

item.title: Netanyahu Backs Referendum for a Peace Agreement With Palestinians
item.description: Putting any peace plan to a public vote is a move that some Israelis view as a potential obstacle to a deal.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: Afghan Government Faces Cash Crunch, I.M.F. Says
item.description: A confidential assessment by the International Monetary Fund said the budget shortfall was caused by tax evasion, corruption and slow economic growth.
item.dc:creator: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG

item.title: IHT Special: Water Conservation Becomes a Higher Priority in U.A.E.
item.description: Farmers in Abu Dhabi are working with the government on ambitious plans to cut their water use in half by next year.
item.dc:creator: By SARA HAMDAN

item.title: IHT Special: Egypt's Long-Term Economic Recovery Plan Stalls
item.description: President Mohamed Morsi’s administration’s failure to revive the country’s ailing economy is likely to be a defining issue in parliamentary elections.
item.dc:creator: By FARAH HALIME
